note.p: Fishing tackle maker and taxidermist. In Market Street, Shrewsbury, 1829. Father of Henry Shaw (1812–87), taxidermist, fishing tackle maker, naturalist, and John Shaw (1816–88), fishing tackle maker, who continued the business in Shrewsbury after their father’s death with their mother Elizabeth (1791–1873), also a fishing tackle maker, 1841.
